noun.description: A long plank balanced in the middle on a fixed support, on each end of which children sit and swing up and down by pushing the ground alternately with their feet.

verb.description: Change rapidly and repeatedly from one position, situation, or condition to another and back again.
examples: the market seesawed as rumors spread of an imminent cabinet reshuffle

origin: Mid 17th century (originally used by sawyers as a rhythmical refrain): reduplication of the verb saw (symbolic of the sawing motion).
